Articles.Content:
Hi everybody,

I'm working on building various SSTO's, and I keep seeing people posting about them using the AeroGUI window to report lift, drag, etc., but I can't for the life of me figure out how to make that window pop up.   Alt-f12, which was the command in KSP1, does not seem to do anything. Could somebody please tell me how to do that? It will make my life immensely easier. Thanks!

Edited June 1, 2023 by herbal space program

Last time I checked it was just F12 but TBH I don't remember if it was changed since that was also default steam screenshot button and you couldn't rebind it (resulting with every other screenshot having the aerogui whether you wanted it or not)

Edited June 4, 2023 by The Aziz

On 6/4/2023 at 4:37 PM, The Aziz said:

Last time I checked it was just F12 but TBH I don't remember if it was changed since that was also default steam screenshot button and you couldn't rebind it (resulting with every other screenshot having the aerogui whether you wanted it or not)

Can somebody test if it is F12? 

I did use F12 for screenshots but I tried to press F12 and it wouldn’t pop up.

It used to be F12 up until this patch 0.1.2.0 when they seem to have removed the keybind. But I too have been seeing some screenshots recently where people have the Aero gui open and would like to know how. I'm not at my game PC right now so I can't test it; I wonder if it's still F12, but only if the keystroke isn't intercepted by Steam? If so, changing your screenshot keybind in Steam might do the trick.

F12 is not working for me anymore. Neither ALT+F12, nor SHIFT + F12, CTRL+F12, or any combination of those.
My steam screenshot is not F12.
F12 is not working for me either. Does anyone know how to open it in v0.1.3?
